info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 3 at 5:52PM EDT until July 3 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Albany NY
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of northwestern Connecticut, including the following county, Litchfield and east central New York, including the following counties, Columbia and Dutchess.
* WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 552 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pine Plains, Millerton, Bethel, Salisbury, Irondale, Mount Riga, Spencer Corners, State Line, Northeast Center, Barton Corners, Pulvers Corners, Whitehouse Crossing, Ore Hill, Ancramdale, Shekomeko, Lakeville and Hammertown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Litchfield, CT; Columbia, NY; Dutchess, NY
